poem:
Title: In the Wake of Waning War

Under the bruised belly of dawn,
Through the spectre of al-Shifa's sorrow,
Unyielding soldiers fold back, withdrawn.
Hamas whispers echo in hollow,
Piercing the hush with a mournful song,
400 souls swimming in shadow.
Red crescent cries, both urgent and long,
Speak of sacrifice, humanity made low,
In hospital halls, unseen yet strong.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israeli forces withdraw from Gaza’s al-Shifa hospital after two-week raid Israeli forces announced their withdrawal from al-Shifa hospital in Gaza on Monday after a two-week raid, amid claims from Hamas that the Israel Defense Forces killed 400 people in the compound and allegations from the Palestinian Red Crescent of torture and “executions”. According to the Israel Defense Forces, the facility – Gaza City’s main hospital before the war – was used to harbour Hamas fighters.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
